page.title: 06LOCAL FARMING
page.content: Farming takes place in this area. "The Old Farm" Toft has 500 acres,mostly used for wheat, the most profitable crop to grow here.A fractional amount of oil seed rape and maize are also produced. There are 4 dogs and many beef cattle and sheep. Machinery is very expensive to buy and maintain. E.g. a harvester costs Â£50 000 and a crawler tractor is Â£36 000. There are 2 employees and 8 tractors. "Highfield Farm" Comberton covers 82 acres. The farmer owns lots of machinery.8 acres are taken up by the campsite which holds upto 120 tents and caravans. On average people stay 2_3 nights.They also own a shop selling things from postcards to ice_creams.The farmer gets up at 7.30 a.m. and spends his day working extremely hard until 12.30 the next morning.
